      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Heap-use-after-free when a tab is added to a tab group in a tabbed PWA window.<span class="line"><!---->Heap-use-after-free when a tab is added to a tab group in a tabbed PWA window.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 98.0.4703.0 <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 98.0.4703.0 <!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>I found two different ways to trigger this issue. Since the stack traces point to the same function, I am reporting both of them here.<span class="line"><!---->I found two different ways to trigger this issue. Since the stack traces point to the same function, I am reporting both of them here.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b> #1<span class="line"><!----> #1<!----></span><br>1. Enable #enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable #enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip<!----></span><br>2. Open the attached PWA and install (live: <span class="line"><!---->2. Open the attached PWA and install (live: <!----></span>https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/"><!---->https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>3. Right-click the opened tab, select "Add tab to a new group"<span class="line"><!---->3. Right-click the opened tab, select "Add tab to a new group"<!----></span><br>4. View page source (CTRL+U)<span class="line"><!---->4.         We should remove this feature for PWAs as a quick fix. I'm not so familiar with the tab grouping code, is there a nice place to "turn off" the feature given a browser->type()? Could it have an enum value in Browser::WindowFeature and we use SupportsWindowFeature() to disable it for app windows?<span class="line"><!---->We should remove this feature for PWAs as a quick fix. I'm not so familiar with the tab grouping code, is there a nice place to "turn off" the feature given a browser-&gt;type()?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Heap-use-after-free when a tab is added to a tab group in a tabbed PWA window.<span class="line"><!---->Heap-use-after-free when a tab is added to a tab group in a tabbed PWA window.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 98.0.4703.0 <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 98.0.4703.0 <!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>I found two different ways to trigger this issue. Since the stack traces point to the same function, I am reporting both of them here.<span class="line"><!---->I found two different ways to trigger this issue. Since the stack traces point to the same function, I am reporting both of them here.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b> #1<span class="line"><!----> #1<!----></span><br>1. Enable #enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable #enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip<!----></span><br>2. Open the attached PWA and install (live: <span class="line"><!---->2. Open the attached PWA and install (live: <!----></span>https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/"><!---->https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>3. Right-click the opened tab, select "Add tab to a new group"<span class="line"><!---->3. Right-click the opened tab, select "Add tab to a new group"<!----></span><br>4. View page source (CTRL+U)<span class="line"><!---->4. View page source (CTRL+U)<!----></span><br><br>If it crashes with "access-violation on unknown address 0xffffffffffffffff", wait 10-30s after launching Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->If it crashes with "access-violation on unknown address 0xffffffffffffffff", wait 10-30s after launching Chrome.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash         This feature is wholly unsupported for Apps currently.<span class="line"><!---->This feature is wholly unsupported for Apps currently.<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc;l=1185?q=chrome%2Fbrowser%2Fui%2Fbrowser.cc&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc;l=1185?q=chrome%2Fbrowser%2Fui%2Fbrowser.cc&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc;l=1185?q=chrome%2Fbrowser%2Fui%2Fbrowser.cc&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><br><br>In order to make the Tab Strip work inside of PWAs some work will need to be done to support SetTabGroupMetadata.<span class="line"><!---->In order to make the Tab Strip work inside of PWAs some work will need to be done to support SetTabGroupMetadata.<!----></span><br><br>alancutter@ im assigning to you since you added the tab-strip flag for PWAs let me know what the next steps are here.<span class="line"><!---->alancutter@ im assigning to you since you added the tab-strip flag for PWAs let me know what the next steps are here.<!----></span><br><br>Im also reprioritizing this down to P2 since this is behind an experimental flag for PWAs (#enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip)<span class="line"><!---->Im also reprioritizing this down to P2 since this is behind an experimental flag for PWAs (#enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Nov 15, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Nov 15, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Nov 15, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Nov 15, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Heap-use-after-free when a tab is added to a tab group in a tabbed PWA window.<span class="line"><!---->Heap-use-after-free when a tab is added to a tab group in a tabbed PWA window.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 98.0.4703.0 <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 98.0.4703.0 <!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>I found two different ways to trigger this issue. Since the stack traces point to the same function, I am reporting both of them here.<span class="line"><!---->I found two different ways to trigger this issue. Since the stack traces point to the same function, I am reporting both of them here.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b> #1<span class="line"><!----> #1<!----></span><br>1. Enable #enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable #enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip<!----></span><br>2. Open the attached PWA and install (live: <span class="line"><!---->2. Open the attached PWA and install (live: <!----></span>https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/"><!---->https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>3.         We should remove this feature for PWAs as a quick fix. I'm not so familiar with the tab grouping code, is there a nice place to "turn off" the feature given a browser->type()? I'm not so familiar with the tab grouping code, is there a nice place to "turn off" the feature given a browser-&gt;type()?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We should remove this feature for PWAs as a quick fix. I'm not so familiar with the tab grouping code, is there a nice place to "turn off" the feature given a browser->type()? I'm not so familiar with the tab grouping code, is there a nice place to "turn off" the feature given a browser-&gt;type()?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Heap-use-after-free when a tab is added to a tab group in a tabbed PWA window.<span class="line"><!---->Heap-use-after-free when a tab is added to a tab group in a tabbed PWA window.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 98.0.4703.0 <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 98.0.4703.0 <!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>I found two different ways to trigger this issue. Since the stack traces point to the same function, I am reporting both of them here.<span class="line"><!---->I found two different ways to trigger this issue. Since the stack traces point to the same function, I am reporting both of them here.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b> #1<span class="line"><!----> #1<!----></span><br>1. Enable #enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable #enable-desktop-pwas-tab-strip<!----></span><br>2. Open the attached PWA and install (live: <span class="line"><!---->2. Open the attached PWA and install (live: <!----></span>https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/"><!---->https://vuln-tabbed-pwa.websec.blog/<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>3. Right-click the opened tab, select "Add tab to a new group"<span class="line"><!---->3. Right-click the opened tab, select "Add tab to a new group"<!----></span><br>4. View page source (CTRL+U)<span class="line"><!---->4. View page source (CTRL+U)<!----></span><br><br>If it crashes with "access-violation on unknown address 0xffffffffffffffff", wait 10-30s after launching Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->If it crashes with "access-violation on unknown address 0xffffffffffffffff", wait 10-30s after launching Chrome.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash         We should remove this feature for PWAs as a quick fix. I'm not so familiar with the tab grouping code, is there a nice place to "turn off" the feature given a browser->type()? Could it have an enum value in Browser::WindowFeature and we use SupportsWindowFeature() to disable it for app windows?<span class="line"><!---->We should remove this feature for PWAs as a quick fix. I'm not so familiar with the tab grouping code, is there a nice place to "turn off" the feature given a browser-&gt;type()? Could it have an enum value in Browser::WindowFeature and we use SupportsWindowFeature() to disable it for app windows?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");

 }

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
